verses.roman:
govinda-virahe śūnya ha-ila tribhuvana
tuṣānale poḍe,--yena nā yāya jīvana

synonyms: govinda-virahe—by separation from Govinda; śūnya—void; ha-ila—became; tri-bhuvana—the three worlds; tuṣa-anale—in the slow fire; poḍe—burns; yena—just like; nā yāya—does not go; jīvana—life.
translation: "The three worlds have become void because of separation from Govinda. I feel as if I were burning alive in a slow fire.
